input_description.intro:
Input data format: { } = optional, [ ] = it depends.
All quantities whose dimensions are not explicitly specified are in RYDBERG ATOMIC UNITS
BEWARE: TABS, DOS <CR><LF> CHARACTERS ARE POTENTIAL SOURCES OF TROUBLE
Comment lines in namelists can be introduced by a "!", exactly as in fortran code. Comments lines in ``cards'' can be introduced by either a "!" or a "#" character in the first position of a line.
Structure of the input data: ===============================================================================
&LR_INPUT ... /

var.name: prefix
var.info: Sets the prefix for generated and read files. The files generated by the ground state pw.x run should have this same prefix.

var.name: outdir
var.info: The directory that contains the run critical files, which include the files generated by ground state pw.x run.

var.name: verbosity
var.info: This integer variable controls the amount of information written to standard output.

var.name: itermax0
var.info: Number of Lanczos coefficients to be read from the file.

var.name: itermax
var.info: The total number of Lanczos coefficients that will be considered in the calculation of the polarizability/absorption coefficient. If itermax > itermax0, the Lanczos coefficients in between itermax0+1 and itermax will be extrapolated.

var.name: epsil
var.info: The broadening/damping term. In Rydberg units if magnons=.false., in meV if magnons = .true.

var.name: units
var.info:
The unit system used for the output and the start, end and increment input parameters. (only meV used in that case).
0 = Rydbergs, 1 = Electron volts, 2 = Nanometres per electron volts, 3 = milli Electron volts (only for magnons=.true.)

var.name: start
var.info: The polarizability and the absorption coefficient are computed starting from this value. In units set.

var.name: end
var.info: The polarizability and the absorption coefficient are computed up to this value. In units set.

var.name: increment
var.info: Incremental step used to define the mesh between start and end. In units set.

var.name: ipol
var.info: An integer variable that determines which element of the dynamical polarizability will be computed: 1 -> alpha_xx(omega), 2 -> alpha_yy(omega), and 3 -> alpha_zz(omega). When set to 4, three Lanczos chains are sequentially performed and the full polarizability tensor and the absorption coefficient are computed.

var.name: eels
var.info: Must be set to .true. for EELS. EELS-specific operations will be performed.

var.name: magnons
var.info: Must be set to .true. for magnon-calculation post-processing.

var.name: td
var.info: When set to 'lanczos', a calculation of the spectrum is performed using the Lanczos coefficients. When set to 'davidson' or 'david', a calculation of the spectrum is performed using the eigenvalues computed using the Davidson algorithm. See the variable 'eign_file'.

var.name: eign_file
var.info: The name of the file produced by the turbo_davidson.x code, in which are written the eigenvalues.
